prompt: Facts: Bachan Singh was tried and convicted for the murder of Desa Singh, Durga Bai, and Veeran Bai.; The Sessions Judge, Ferozepore, sentenced Bachan Singh to death under Section 302, Indian Penal Code (IPC) on August 1, 1977.; The High Court of Punjab and Haryana confirmed the death sentence and dismissed Bachan Singh's appeal on April 27, 1979.; Bachan Singh filed an appeal by special leave to the Supreme Court of India.; The core issue raised before the Supreme Court's Constitution Bench was the constitutional validity of the death penalty provision in Section 302, IPC.; The challenge argued that the death penalty violated the fundamental rights guaranteed under Articles 14 (Equality before law), 19 (Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, etc. - specifically Art 19(1)), and 21 (Protection of life and personal liberty) of the Constitution of India.; The validity of Section 354(3) of the Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 (CrPC), which requires 'special reasons' for imposing the death sentence, was also considered in relation to the constitutional challenge. | IPC: Section 302 (Punishment for Murder)
